title: Dark Horses: Support Volibear.
body:
Riot please. Who wants to go near a bush with a big bear in there?

Most bot laners don't take ignite, making Volibears passive healing when low on health helpful and hard to deal with.

Volibear has a decent AOE slow and is incredible at aiding jungle ganks and even defending team mates while soaking up damage and his ultimate is also great for pushing turrets - if left alone in lane he can also be an incredible solo split pusher which is rare for a support and he can get in and out of fights with relative ease.

replies.body: and when you're bored u can spam dance exdd
Most supports in bronze don't take ignite. Most people higher up take ignite about 80% of the time and if they see you playing voli support they probably will take it.
I meant clearing waves and deterring enemies from coming nearby if they are low and it still procs on minions nearby when he is hitting turret.

They won't go near a bear in a brush but they'll probably light it on fire.

A good poke/kite composition, EZ/Vayne + Sona will easily make Volibear useless in high ELO. Ezreals and Vayne will destroy you, Vayne especially.
Ignite is actually more common than you might think, the support can take it over exhaust to prioritise early game kill secures.

One of the problems with AoE slows is that they're AoE, your adc might not like that in SoloQ. His gapclosing really isn't that great without Flash or Righteous Glory. Volibear is better in the Jungle if you want to use his CC because if he's always in lane, the enemy will see his Q+RG+Flash charge.

One of an ADC's strategy is to be the splitpusher. Volibear isn't that great with the likes of Wukong, Nasus, etc. He's far more useful as a tank.

I think it's better to describe Volibear bot as a potential 'kill lane' partner, rather than a support. But then again, almost every other champion is great for kill lanes, Jarvan IV and Lee Sin do a far better job shutting down the enemy's bot lane as "support".
